channel.title: Posts on Elchwald
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Elchwald

item.title: About me
item.description:
I’m a German software developer, currently residing in Augsburg (Bavaria) Most of the time, I’m busy with writing free software. I care for privacy, therefore you won’t find me on social networks. If you want to contact me, email is the way to go: sahib@online.de. Alternatively you can use my XMPP handle: sahib@jabber.nullcat.de. If you want to talk privately to me, my GPG Key ID is AF3D5DAC.

Things I like (in no particular order):
Table tennis (as team leader), Tattoos, Cooking, Biking & Hiking, Metal, Bad Selfmade Art, Nature, Cats and Terry Pratchett books.

TODO: Tagcloud with technical interests/frameworks? Thanks to my FOSS projects (Interests: system programming, algorithms, linux/unix, network and backend programming, frontend,)

I’m confident in all aspects related to creating software from scratch. This includes designing, developing, packaging, documenting, testing, porting, working with the community, filing bugs and getting bug reports. I specialize in doing systems programming.

Languages:

  • German (Mother’s tongue)
  • English (fluently spoken and written)

item.title: Projects
item.description:
Active and maintained:

  • 2015-2016: brig (Go): distributed file synchronization tool
  • 2010-2016: rmlint (C): with optional GUI (Python)
  • 2016: eulenfunk: (C, Go)

Currently on hold:

  • libglyr (C): Music Metadata retrieval library, used in gmpc
  • moosecat (C, Python): Powerful Desktop MPD-Client with GTK+ Frontend.
  • SnÃ¸bÃ¦r (C, Python, Coffeescript): Webmpdclient based on moosescat.
  • nom

Dead and small stuff:

  • libmunin
  • catlight
  • par.py

If you like my work, you might consider a donation
